questions.question_text:
You are the owner of an alert.
You receive an email notification that the alert was suspended.
From where can you resume the suspended alert?

choices.B: The Data Source page of Tableau Desktop
choices.C: The Notifications area of Tableau Prep
choices.A: The My Content area of Tableau web pages

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Manage your data-driven alerts
You can manage alerts from the My Content area of Tableau web pages, but doing so directly from alert emails can be quicker. Click the links below the image to manage all your alerts, or add or remove yourself from the emailed alert. If you're the alert owner, click Edit this alert to change alert settings such as threshold, schedule, and recipients.
All alerts are scheduled from tableau server. So, Option A is correct

comments.content: Hello, did you pass using these? Are the questions same/similar? Please answer.

questions.question_text:
A colleague provides you with access to a folder that contains the following files:

Sales.csv -

Book1.twb -

Sales.hyper -

Export.mdb -
Which file contains an extract?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Sales.hyper
.tde (Tableau Data Extract)
.hyper (Tableau Hyper Data Extract)
B. Sales.hyper, this is because when we create an extract, Tableau Desktop creates a local file (. tde or . hyper) and the default location is in "My Tableau Repository" folder.
v10.5 onwards extract files is getting saved in high performance .hyper type

Selected Answer: ABE
A. Run a refresh – You can trigger an extract refresh to update the data in the published workbook.

B. Change the refresh from full to incremental – You can adjust the refresh type, choosing incremental refresh to only update new or changed data, rather than refreshing the entire dataset.

E. Modify the frequency of the refresh – You can set how often the extract should refresh (e.g., daily, weekly).

So, the correct options are A, B, and E.

Selected Answer: ACE
D is not typically available on the Extract Refresh page itself.

Selected Answer: ADE
I proved it on Tableau Cloud

questions.question_text:
You have a workbook that uses an extracted data source.

You publish the workbook to Tableau Server.

Which three actions can you perform from the Extract Refresh page in Tableau Server? (Choose three.)

choices.C: Change the priority of the refresh.
choices.B: Change the refresh from full to incremental.
choices.E: Modify the frequency of the refresh.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have the following worksheet.

//IMG//


You want to create a table calculation that shows sales growth over each year.

How should you complete the formula? (Use the dropdowns in the Answer Area to select the correct options to complete the formula.)

//IMG//

discussion.content: The previous year must also be entered in the divider

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

You have the following calculated fields in a worksheet.

[Calc1] = DATEADD (‘year’, -1, TODAY ())

[Calc2] = DATETRUNC (‘month’, DATEADD (‘year’, -1, TODAY ())

You want to calculate the month to date value of the prior year.

How should you complete the formula? (Drag the appropriate Options to the Answer Area and drop into the correct locations.)

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Tested. The correct answer is 
First option : Calc1
Second option : Calc2
